translation: Dhāraṇī of Great Love Spoken by the Buddha

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝散大夫試光祿卿
translation: Tripiṭaka of the Western Translation of the Sutra, Chaozan Dashi, and Guangluqing

source_sentence: 明教大師臣法賢奉　詔譯
translation: Mingjiao dashi ministers, Faxian, in accordance with the imperial edict, translated
Thus I have heard.

source_sentence: 一時佛在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: One time, the Buddha was at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.
Then, there was a sea god named Great Love.
He came to the Buddha and when he arrived, he bowed his head to the ground and saluted his feet.
He bowed his head to the ground with his feet at the Buddha's feet.
He withdrew to one side and said to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 世尊我有所願利益眾生。
translation: "Bhagavān, I have a wish to benefit sentient beings.
Please have mercy on me, Buddha, and allow me to proclaim it.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊知大愛心有大利益。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān knew that a mind of great love has great benefit.
He told him, "Good, good!
Do as you wish for the benefit of others.
It was then that Dānavat heard and approved by the Buddha.
He said to the Buddha.
"I've been living in the ocean with my retinue.
We've often seen sentient beings caught in the ocean's difficulties.
With these things in mind, I want to explain the dhāraṇī.
That way, those oceanic difficulties won't be able to harm us.

source_sentence: 世尊若有善男子善女人乃至苾芻苾芻尼優婆塞優婆夷等。
translation: Bhagavān, suppose there are good men and good women, even bhikṣus and nuns, upāsaka and upāsikā.
hear this dhāraṇī, recite it, memorize it, and uphold it.

source_sentence: 及得聞我與眷屬等名者。
translation: They then hear the words "I and my retinue.

source_sentence: 所有大海一切危難悉皆解脫。
translation: They'll be freed from all the great sea of danger and hardship.
At the time, the great beloved acknowledged the Buddha's authority.
He then spoke the dhāraṇī, saying.

source_sentence: 怛[寧*也](切身)他(引一)祖嚕祖嚕(二)吐蘭達哩(引三)摩賀(引)謗哥悉體(二合)帝(引四)酤(引)儞瑟哥(二合引)儞瑟計(二合五)阿那護(六)拶鉢黎(引七)祖嚕祖嚕(八)三滿多跋捺哩(二合引九)阿屹儞(二合)作訖哩(二合引十)作訖囉(二合)多朗(十一)補囉儗儞(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引十二)爾時大愛海神承佛聖旨。
translation: "Tāna [nin*ya] (cut to body) (citation 1) Zuludzulu (2) Turandhari (citation 3) Mahā (citation) Kantaka Siddhi (citation 4) Deok (citation) Nisarg (citation 2) Nisarg (citation 2) Nisarg (citation 2) 5) Anavu (citation 6) Khri (citation 7) Zuludzulu (8) Samantabhadri (citation 2) 9) Ayanin (citation 2) Zokhiri (citation 2) 10) Zokhira (citation 2) Dolang (citation 11) Potala Nisarg (citation) Sahya (citation 2) He (citation 12) At the time, the ocean god Mahākālai acknowledged the Buddha's noble command.
After speaking this dhāraṇī, he rejoiced, jumped up and down, saluted the Buddha, and gave him a salutation.
He rejoiced, jumped up and down, saluted the Buddha, and withdrew.
Foshuo daiai luizhao tuoluoni jing
